definitions: covered with or as if with a blanket of material
completely hidden or obscured from view by something covering it
examples: The mountains were blanketed with fresh snow overnight
The entire town became blanketed in thick morning fog
Important details were blanketed by bureaucratic jargon
The scandal was blanketed by other major news events

definitions: showing contempt or irreverence toward God, religious beliefs, or sacred things
examples: The artist's blasphemous depiction of religious figures sparked controversy
Many considered his jokes about sacred rituals to be blasphemous

definitions: damaged, destroyed, or affected by an explosion or strong force
used to express annoyance or frustration with something extremely irritating
examples: The blasted landscape showed evidence of recent bombing
Workers removed blasted rock from the construction site
That blasted alarm clock woke me up too early
I can't find my blasted keys anywhere in the house

definitions: producing or using explosive force or extremely loud sound
expressing harsh criticism in a forceful or public manner
examples: The blasting music from next door kept everyone awake
Construction crews were blasting through solid rock all day
The senator gave a blasting speech against the new policy
Critics were blasting the movie for its poor storyline

definitions: done openly and unashamedly in an obvious way without attempt to hide
examples: His blatant disregard for the rules got him fired
The advertisement contained blatant false claims about the product

definitions: burning fiercely with bright flames and intense heat
shining with extremely bright or dazzling light that overwhelms the eyes
showing intense emotion, especially anger, in a dramatic way
examples: The blazing fire quickly spread through the dry forest
Firefighters battled the blazing building for several hours
The blazing sun made it impossible to work outside
She walked across the blazing hot sand to the water
They had a blazing argument that ended their friendship
His blazing temper made everyone avoid him when angry

definitions: made white or pale by chemical treatment or removal of color
having lost natural color through prolonged exposure to sun or elements
examples: Her bleached hair contrasted with her dark eyebrows
The hospital uses bleached linens to ensure proper sanitation
The desert sun left the bones bleached and brittle
Years of sunlight had bleached the curtains nearly white

definitions: offering little or no hope, happiness, or encouragement; depressing
exposed to harsh weather and lacking warmth, shelter, or vegetation
examples: The economic forecast looks bleak for the coming year
She painted a bleak picture of life without education
The bleak landscape stretched endlessly under gray winter skies
They huddled together in the bleak waiting room

definitions: combined or mixed together smoothly to form a unified whole
examples: The chef created a perfectly blended sauce for the pasta
Their blended family worked hard to create new traditions together

definitions: made holy or consecrated by religious ceremony; favored by God
bringing pleasure, contentment, or good fortune; fortunate and happy
examples: The priest blessed the congregation at the end of service
They considered their child a blessed gift from above
We spent a blessed week away from work stress
She felt blessed to have such supportive friends

definitions: affected by plant disease that causes withering and death
spoiled, harmed, or destroyed, especially by adverse conditions
examples: The blighted crops meant farmers would face severe losses
Botanists studied the blighted trees to identify the disease
Urban renewal targeted blighted neighborhoods for redevelopment
His blighted childhood left lasting emotional scars

definitions: deprived of sight or unable to see temporarily or permanently
unable to think clearly or rationally due to strong emotion
examples: The bright flash temporarily blinded the photographer
The accident left him permanently blinded in one eye
She was blinded by jealousy and couldn't see the truth
Love had blinded him to her obvious faults

definitions: designed to cover the eyes to prevent seeing
examples: The blindfold test proved the wine expert's abilities
Children played a blindfold game at the birthday party

definitions: having the eyes covered with cloth or bandage to prevent seeing
examples: The blindfolded participants tried to identify objects by touch
Justice is often depicted as a blindfolded woman holding scales

definitions: so bright as to overwhelm vision or cause temporary inability to see
so intense or overwhelming as to prevent clear thinking or judgment
examples: The blinding headlights made it dangerous to drive at night
A blinding flash of lightning illuminated the entire sky
She felt blinding rage when she discovered the betrayal
His blinding ambition prevented him from seeing the consequences

definitions: turning on and off repeatedly in a regular or irregular pattern
examples: The blinking lights on the router indicated internet connectivity issues
Stars appeared like blinking lights in the clear night sky

definitions: experiencing or producing complete happiness and joy; perfectly content
examples: The couple spent a blissful honeymoon on the tropical island
She remained in blissful ignorance of the problems ahead

definitions: so hot as to cause or be capable of causing blisters
expressing harsh criticism or scorn in an intense manner
moving or performed at extremely high speed or intensity
examples: The blistering desert heat made travel dangerous during midday
She got a blistering sunburn after forgetting sunscreen
The manager delivered a blistering critique of the team's performance
His blistering remarks left everyone in uncomfortable silence
The runner maintained a blistering pace throughout the marathon
The band played at a blistering tempo

definitions: showing a casual and cheerful indifference considered to be callous or improper
examples: Her blithe dismissal of safety concerns worried her colleagues
He maintained a blithe attitude despite mounting problems

definitions: swollen with fluid or gas causing uncomfortable distension
unnecessarily or undesirably large, excessive, or inflated
examples: He felt bloated after eating too much at dinner
The bloated corpse was found floating in the river
The bloated budget included many unnecessary expenses
Critics called the bloated software inefficient and slow

definitions: sealed off or surrounded to prevent goods or people from entering or leaving
examples: The blockaded port prevented food shipments from arriving
Protesters blockaded the main entrance to the building

definitions: in the process of sealing off an area to prevent movement in or out
examples: Naval forces were blockading the enemy harbor
The blockading troops prevented any supplies from entering the city

definitions: having movement or passage prevented by an obstacle
prevented from occurring or progressing by interference
examples: The blocked drain caused water to back up
Traffic was completely blocked by the fallen tree
Her promotion was blocked by office politics
The blocked legislation never made it to a vote

definitions: having a solid, angular shape resembling rectangular blocks
examples: The blocky architecture of the building looked dated
His blocky handwriting was difficult to read

definitions: having hair of a pale yellow or golden color
examples: The blond child stood out among his dark-haired siblings
She dyed her hair blond for the summer

definitions: having hair of a pale yellow or golden color, especially referring to females
examples: The blonde actress was known for her iconic hairstyle
She went from brunette to blonde with professional highlights

definitions: having pure breeding or aristocratic ancestry, especially in animals
having experience in battle or violent conflict
examples: The blooded horses commanded high prices at auction
Only blooded aristocrats could join the exclusive club
The blooded veterans knew how to handle combat situations
These blooded warriors had survived many battles

definitions: achieved without violence or killing
lacking vigor, emotion, or liveliness; appearing pale
examples: The revolution was remarkably bloodless with minimal casualties
They negotiated a bloodless transfer of power
His bloodless face showed the effects of illness
The bloodless performance failed to move the audience

definitions: having eyes with visible red blood vessels due to tiredness, strain, or irritation
examples: His bloodshot eyes revealed he hadn't slept in days
Allergies left her with bloodshot eyes every spring

definitions: marked or covered with blood, especially from violence or injury
examples: Police found bloodstained clothing at the crime scene
The bloodstained bandages needed to be changed regularly

definitions: having or showing a desire to kill or see violence and bloodshed
examples: The bloodthirsty crowd demanded harsh punishment for criminals
Historical accounts describe the bloodthirsty conquests of ancient warriors

definitions: producing flowers or in the state of producing flowers
appearing healthy, attractive, and full of youthful vigor
examples: The blooming roses filled the garden with fragrance
Spring brought blooming flowers to every yard
She looked blooming with health after her vacation
The blooming economy created many new job opportunities

definitions: marked with irregular patches or spots of color or texture
examples: His blotched skin showed signs of sun damage
The blotched leaves indicated a plant disease

definitions: moved or carried by wind or air current
damaged or destroyed by explosion or excessive pressure
examples: Blown leaves covered the entire driveway after the storm
Her blown hair made it hard to see while driving
The blown tire caused the car to swerve dangerously
Engineers examined the blown gasket to determine the cause

definitions: having a direct, good-natured manner that might seem abrupt but is honest
examples: His bluff manner put nervous employees at ease
The bluff sea captain was beloved by his crew

definitions: having a slight blue color or tinge
examples: The bluish tint in her lips indicated she was cold
Mountains appeared bluish in the distant morning haze

definitions: having a worn-down edge or point that is not sharp
speaking in a direct way without trying to be polite or diplomatic
examples: The blunt knife struggled to cut through the meat
Years of use had made the scissors blunt
Her blunt assessment of the situation shocked the board
I appreciate his blunt honesty about my performance

definitions: made less sharp or pointed through use or deliberate action
reduced in force, intensity, or effectiveness
examples: The blunted blade needed professional sharpening
Repeated use had blunted the cutting edge
Years of disappointment had blunted his enthusiasm
The new policy blunted the impact of the recession

definitions: not clear or distinct in outline or detail; difficult to perceive clearly
examples: The blurred photograph was taken with a shaky hand
My blurred vision meant I needed new glasses

definitions: not clear or sharply defined; having indistinct edges or details
examples: The blurry image made it hard to identify faces
Everything looked blurry without her contact lenses

definitions: having face reddened from embarrassment, shyness, or romantic feelings
examples: The blushing bride walked slowly down the aisle
His blushing face revealed his embarrassment about the mistake

definitions: showing excessive pride and self-satisfaction in achievements, possessions, or abilities
examples: His boastful stories about wealth annoyed his colleagues
The boastful athlete lost fans with constant self-promotion

definitions: having a tail that is naturally short or has been cut short
examples: The bobtail cat was born with a naturally short tail
Bobtail horses were common in certain breeding programs

definitions: having a body of a specified type, used in combinations
examples: The full-bodied wine had rich, complex flavors
A strong-bodied athlete excelled at contact sports

definitions: relating to or affecting the human body rather than mind
examples: The accident caused serious bodily harm to passengers
Regular exercise promotes bodily health and mental wellness

definitions: consisting of wet, spongy ground that is too soft to support heavy weight
examples: The boggy terrain made hiking extremely difficult
Cattle avoided the boggy areas near the stream

definitions: not genuine or true; fraudulent or counterfeit
examples: The police arrested him for using bogus identification
Her bogus medical degree fooled patients for years

definitions: living an unconventional lifestyle, often artistic, with few regard for social conventions
examples: The bohemian neighborhood attracted artists and musicians
Her bohemian lifestyle shocked her conservative parents

definitions: cooked or processed by heating in boiling water or liquid
examples: The boiled eggs were perfect for the salad
Boiled vegetables retained their nutritional value

definitions: noisy, energetic, and cheerful in a way that lacks restraint
examples: The boisterous children made concentration impossible
A boisterous crowd celebrated the team's victory
